J8H3nO2jk2vbHJcyhrmKeQ.text: Delicious food, but the service is shit.  My boyfriend and I went in for an early dinner and were the only patrons in the restaurant. Our waitress was able to take our order adequately enough, but after our food arrived we never saw her again. In fact to get the bill we had to shout at her from across the restaurant.  Furthermore, the gratuity was automatically included in the bill...which we refused to pay.  The only thing that saves this review is the excellent food.

VGgryARLZIOvzfG4879w2w.text: I ordered the Canadian burger at Hache. The burger comes with cured bacon and mature cheddar on a brioche roll. Hache markets themselves as being "burger connoisseurs". While my burger was quite good I don't think Hache's burgers are in the same class as other gourmet burgers. My beef was juicy and cooked medium as I ordered, however the bun was a bit over-toasted. The burger needed some liberal pours of ketchup and mustard to make up for the bun and to give it that salt/acid profile to make my mouth water.

photos.caption: Photo of Hache - London, United Kingdom. Canadian Burger

XvZOBXQAiYqwaUTmC_Xk2A.text: Burger was tasty but the ciabatta roll I chose was too dry.   Serving the fries in baskets was a nice touch but makes for a bit of a mess when you want to add salt or vinegar.  The decor felt a bit confusing, more like a french restaurant than a burger joint!Worth a try just make sure you have the brioche roll :-)

QZncqAVyw6yKQ2TD3rmCBA.text: I'm back! Back from the cultural wasteland of [country not to be disclosed, too many friends there...]! Back to great restaurants and more choice than one person should be allowed to have!!First review: Hache. I was actually waiting for Maggies to open as I'd rather embarrassingly lost my phone there on New Year's Eve. I know... at my age... Maggies... shame on me... Still, they played Huey Lewis, so the place rocks!Stopped by Hache for a quick bite while I waited and wasn't at all dissappointed. The ambience and decor is very inviting and warm. It makes you want to sit at the bar by the window, have a few beers and a very, very decent burger, and watch the Fulham Road girls pass you by.They were fresh out of the Venison burger with Reblechon, unfortunately, as that would have a been a great litmus test, but the steak burger with Reblechon was a very suitable alternative. I'm not a huge fan of sweet substances with my savory food (there's a time and place, and they are rarely together in a main meal, in my humble opinion), so I could have done with less of the homemade Red Onion Chutney, but the burger itself was delicious with the crunchy chicory and lovely melted smelly cheese. It had a really good flame grilled taste and very juicy.I'd definitely go back to work my way through the menu.Oh, alas no phone.... but at least I got a good burger, a few beers, and a lovely view to satisfy an otherwise dissapointing night!

rgYsGJyo4HOkijlxyLqZrw.text: Love the steak Spanish!  my favorite place for burgers in London.  So glad they opened one recently in Shoreditch.  They have  huge selection and I enjoy trying the monthly specials which are always quiet interesting.

photos.caption: Photo of Hache - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Hache - London, United Kingdom. Canadian
Photo of Hache - London, United Kingdom. Frites

2BWGCIX4fNJzl-grSMsDvw.text: Haché (which means chopped/minced/ground in French) is a burger shop. A fancy gourmet place yes, but a burger shop nonetheless. The layout and atmosphere is quite refined and very visually appealing (and so are the staff!) and fairly comfortable to settle into. The cocktail menu is startling brief with maybe 5 named cocktails and no listed beer options. Really? I'm having a burger so a pint would have suited perfectly but it was not to be. Listen up Haché, if you want me to take you seriously get some more options in there stat!The menu is pretty straightforward. You have a pretty impressive selection of steak burgers with choices ranging from the Mexican (jalapenos, salsa, guacamole, and sour cream) to the Catalan (chorizo and chilli jam) to the standard cheeseburger (and a couple with different more unusual cheeses I couldn't spell if my life depended on int). There are also a couple of lamb burgers, a handful of chicken and veggie ones, and a duck burger (which they were sadly all out of that night).I had the Mexican and while the presentation was brilliant with the various components arriving in a divided side dish so you could add to your taste the ingredients themselves left a lot to be desired. First, the burger was more medium well than the ordered medium rare which left the patty a bit dry and tasteless. The guacamole and salsa were decent but fairly mild. I like a spicy salsa and a rich creamy guac but there seemed more out of a jar than freshly made and had lost some of their flavour. The jalapenos were terrible and definitely from a can as there was no heat and a bit of that waterlogged texture you get when peppers have been soaking in something for too long. Finally, the ciabatta bread was so dry it crumbled in my hands as I tried to eat the burger which was an epic fail.I did finish it but likely more from pure hunger than any food ecstasy. To be honest, I was disappointed in it as I'd heard great things from trusted sources. Maybe it was just a bad day, as my fellow diners were similarly unimpressed. The brioche option was a bit better but also on the dry side so overall 1 star for the buns.The redeeming factor (other than the gorgeous red head I wanted to marry on the spot) were the sides. Being all stubborn people who refused to compromise of which sides to get, we pretty much ordered them all. The regular fries were crunchy on the outside and fluffy inside and disappeared in no time. The sweet potato fries were even better with a rich sweetness that was highly addictive. The potato wedges were crispy and came with an incredible garlic mayo dip that I almost wanted to eat plain. The grilled haloumi worked well although was oddly garnished with a couple of slices of red chilli and the coleslaw was surprisingly tasty with a focus on the veggies and not the mayo. The onion rings were good but slightly less so than the rest due to the hoppy beer taste in the batter which was just a bit too much.Overall, Haché is a decent burger joint but nothing to get too excited about purely on the burgers alone. However, when you add in the atmosphere and the sides, it's definitely above average. I'll keep it in mind as I continue my burger quest around town!Note: Make reservations as even early on in the week it gets busy. However, call as their online system will make your reservation but will not prompt them to call you to confirm.

eNnYuTOWYFoIEhrDVlfKCg.text: Great burger, but the wedges were insanely good! The best I'd ever had. Onion rings weren't my favourite, overly large, slightly greasy.Next time, I'll be just having a bacon cheese burger, wedges and coffee. Coffee is illy and very nice.Only giving 4/5 as my burger wasn't the best, but I think it was the choice I had.

photos.caption: Photo of Hache - London, United Kingdom. Nom nom nom
Photo of Hache - London, United Kingdom. The best wedges I've ever tried
Photo of Hache - London, United Kingdom

h7kExRrlpZ0xjnl7zkl1FA.text: Tip: They don't take reservations for after 7:30pm on weekends (but they still asked if we had a reservation when we walked in at 8! Just to confuse people I assume!)Burgers are lovely here, same as Camden. And you have to try the onion rings that everyone's talking about. Portions are big-ish, so do watch out. Another plus: Excellent service with a smile :) big smile :DEasily one of my favourite burger places right now.

photos.caption: Photo of Hache - London, United Kingdom

0iaXelmXqhWlePQgGqehrw.text: Ode to my BurgerYou're all I've ever wanted for a dinner.Hache, this burger is really a winner.Delicious meatserved on tomatoes, onion and salad so sweet.Perfectly toasted bun.Sweet potato fries on the side are fun.As everyone says, delicious burgers!  Decent London prices.  Great atmosphere.  The best deal is the steak au naturel burger.  For some of the other burgers--the canadien, for example-- Hache charges 3 pounds additional just for bacon and cheese.  Delicious smoothies-- I had the banana berry (with a fun twisty straw).  My husband had the chocolate shake-- it was good, too, but not as good as American shakes.  Sweet potato fries are amazing.

nXh_8cYHt2_y0_lRE7seDw.text: This is an adorable little burger place in South Kensington.  The decor is so cute and the food was delicious.  I got the chicken burger with caramelized onions and got the salad option instead of the bun and they give you a nice salad which was a change from Byron which gives you the tiniest, dinkiest salad.  You must get the sweet potato fries though, they were to die for!!! Also if you check in to this place you get a free glass of wine or a beer which is always a positive.

751E3V5nwGOMHN9YRiC4Fw.text: If you can find a better burger in London then please, please tell me where it is!? Hache is typical of the many restaurants in that area. The service is relaxed and friendly, there is quite a nice ambience and the food is really good. It is very reasoably priced and you can't go wrong with the burgers. The desert is nice also. Warning: You'll never eat at a GBK again if you try this place!

KBtayQUWC_4Hj7BX9r2KeQ.text: I ve tried the the new restaurant in Clapham Common, I had never heard of this restaurant before. I was nicely surprised by the quality of the food and the service. The best burger I've ever eaten in London. The ciabatta bread is just delicious and the portions are generous. I could not eat till the day after!I look forward to having another meal there! Well done guys!

UwfM-RlDbwZEUHzYqHwqww.text: Nice choice of upscale burger which I (vegetarian) and my family (not) enjoy.

fOUSKThCfN1GnmKQVA1Y0Q.text: One of, if not the, best burgers in London. Big fan of their variety. Everything you might get on your burger is very high quality but the meat could be better. Get the potato wedges.

v5B0gc02PlumhXCAkDjYsA.text: 4 or 5 stars?  Probably should call it 4.5.  Haché is possibly my favourite burger place in London.  As Andrew says, the interior is pretty slick, but the prices are right in line with places like Byron and GBK.  Discounting GBK entirely, I think I'd choose Haché 9 out of 10 times (although the courgette fries at Byron are really good).Anyway, the menu is pretty varied with a number of items not what you'd expect from a French-style place (such as the peanut butter/cheese Louisiana, or the Bollywood which contains an onion bhaji and mango chutney).  They also do steak, lamb burgers, chicken burgers, tuna steak burger, and veggie burgers, but I cannot vouch for the veggie lot (I know that it's not exactly difficult to find a veggie burger which appears to be made of sawdust, but I assume Haché are above that).  Medium rare is usually the way to go, and the patties usually come out pretty juicy (I'm sorry about Andrew M.'s experience - this hasn't happened to me before...plus I may well have been one of those who recommended the place...).  Oh, and you get a choice between a ciabatta and a brioche bun.  I tend to go for the brioche, even if it is the vastly less healthy option - it's not sweet brioche, and has that nice shiny egg-glazed top which makes me happy.My favourites are definitely the Milano (mozzarella, parmesan, sun-dried tomato) and the Catalan (chorizo, chilli, and tomato jam).  I tried the Bollywood last time which, whilst ok, disappointingly contained a rather burnt onion bhaji.  The chips are good too, plus one side is generally enough for 2 people (they bring them out in a frying basket, which is pretty cool).Price-wise, the plain burger comes in at £6.95, most of the options come in at £8.95, and the most expensive (the double one...nom) is £12.95.  Most of the sides are between £3 and £3.50, so you can get away with a meal for just over a tenner.  Considering that the same money will get you a mediocre burger at somewhere like GBK or Union Burger (does that place still exist?), it's a bit of a no-brainer.  Shame that Haché doesn't seem to open in the most accessible or central locations, but in my experience, it's been well worth going a little out the way for it.

9Q7wKRHXdz-Wi-LMbBTT6w.text: The best burger restaurant in London, there are a lot of choice, the decor is nice and the service is perfect. If you are french and don't speak english, no problem, one waiter speaks french very well. I recommend the "Spanish Burger" with goat cheese which is delicious with white wine Cabernet Sauvignon !

jgktkxCS_CC37tRmoyoieg.text: Hache has been on a number of burger blogs of late and being in the area for lunch took it as the perfect opportunity to visit.  I've tried a few round London, Honest, MeatMarket and this was up there, possibly not as meaty in flavour but the different options available makes me want to come back. Bavarian cheese, Parma ham, chorizo anyone? With a choice of bun, brioche or ciabatta.  I ordered the Bavarian cheese burger, with fries.  I believe a burger must be juicy and messy experience with the bun holding it all together till the end.  This was perfect with the cheese working well with the burger giving it a slightly smokey feel but not at all overpowering; with great fries (including sweet potato) making this a place I want to come back to.  Probably not as good a beef patty as Honest or MeatMarket my current champs, didn't get a strong meaty taste but the patty was bigger and more filling.  Good service although it was quiet, although the ambience was less burger bar more restaurant.  Definitely coming back to try the other burgers and the deserts which looked equally good.

cDzQoXCrBzAEr6nPIcpv6A.text: Didn't live up to the hype. The falafel burger was okay. Service was alright.

xYBTalB5fPoNBl60J3SBGA.text: Nice decor and friendly staff.I am a local and have been here a number of times but can't help feeling ripped off lately. They slice the chicken so thinly in the chicken burgers it's just rude. I want to love this place but can't.They've also stopped serving the signature Banoffee pie! OMG what were you thinking!

HRAye1jGBJ-h7NM7aPOkNg.text: Great burgers and really fab chunky chips, quite family friendly but the kids were obviously well catered for as we didn't notice them much. Service was good and decor just what you want from a burger place that is trying to be everything that BK or McD's isn't

4JFF9FXTQxzT2mCL9b0sNA.text: Great burgers and beverage service. We were on a long European vacation and really needed some good burgers. Haché hit the spot!Tried the Louisiana burger - unique but very tasty.

oii7nn2bzegMRVGZXXRKgg.text: Serve Sunday breakfast until 1pm. Great vanilla milkshake and Parisian breakfast. Great way to start a lazy SundayGood location on Fulham road in Chelsea.

KLAcFlHDcBCOH0bmnOKTQQ.text: For an English place making themselves American-style burgers, this is my favorite. It's hard to please an ex-pat.

rDTcVmzcXqE7AgU160NFqg.text: I ate here for the first time tonight.  They serve up some very good burgers!  I had the Steak Canadian, which had cheese and bacon.  The cheese was tasty, as was the meat.  Their bacon was saltier than most bacon, but still good.  In addition to great burgers, this place has delicious sweet potato fries.  The service was prompt and the food was great! I will definitely be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Hache - London, United Kingdom. Steak Canadian

J01iSmxCD09fGFxdCMA1Lw.text: Ok, haven't been in awhile! Some nice interesting menu options/upgrades! Here's my 1£ review as of now, Aug 20 something. The food options and made fresh burgers "in house" still noticeably nice! But for an otherwise fairly quiet Sat evening and only about 4 tables, the feeling of "hurry up/I'm stressed out" service vibe by our beautiful Eastern European waitstaff, left me feeling too much like I feel on a fully booked 777 as the flight attendant that I am!  Still, great food, just don't understand the service vibe when it's not packed at all. I can totally relate when your work space is packed! Just wasn't the case.

HVJc-6l0QF3I-teYsPJDSA.text: We love Hache!! We go there every year when we go to London! The burgers are great and you have a nice selection to choose from.. the atmosphere is cute and quaint! Service is always good! See you next year Hache!

22gxtNH5qn7WJ9bUax2X_Q.text: One of the best burgers I have had. The La Fume was an extraordinary burger with amazing smokey flavor to it. The Truffle burger was also amazing. We ordered the sweet potato fries, which were also fabulous. Would totally recommend this burger place!

-1bgc0OKsNPDnscBtXV6Hg.text: My memories of previous (pre-Yelping) visits to Haché were quite let down by my visit today.I went in for a late lunch - around 3pm. There was only one other person in the place so the waiter told me to sit anywhere. One of my pet peeves, this. Surely the waiter knows the best places to sit, that are convenient for them and comfortable for me. The table I chose must have been close to the kitchen, as it was quite noisy.I have always remembered that Haché is my favourite burger chain burger in London. I'm not often by one so when I was today, I was really looking forward to it. I like that you get to choose a your bun, and I ordered a cheeseburger on brioche with no rocket, chips, garlic mayo, and a Coke.My food came quickly but without the garlic mayo, which I asked for again. He said I didn't order it... Now considering I was one of the only people in the place, that doesn't bode well for a busy day! He called back to the kitchen and asked for it, went and put it through the till, and then proceeded to sit and talk to the other member of staff who came in to talk about his schedule with the manager. Loudly. This other member of staff was American, in a bright blue suit, carrying a bag from Diptyque (what waiter can afford Diptyque?!) and had to have his shifts changed because his mom twisted her ankle coming off the bus and he had to help her 'pack boxes and move shit'. Oh, you mean you don't want to read this in my review? Oddly enough, I didn't want to hear about it while I waited for my garlic mayo, either. By the time I got it, I was half way done with my food.And the food... The burger had a couple of bits of grizzle, but otherwise was tasty. The chips were nice. The garlic mayo wasn't very punchy, but it was okay. I'm not a fan of brioche for burger buns, but it's not too sweet here and works, in my opinion.With the service charge, it was £17.50, so really, too expensive for what was only okay. I left disappointed with my memories tarnished. Sob!

5xeMofqwSanRUTsOfgDZJQ.text: I had the Fume and boy did it deliver on smokiness! Amazing burgers, very very good fries ... what's not to like! Great place for a casual catch up dinner with friends!

vGgm5LYdOxRJU_tZuCmjHg.text: Just had dinner here.Great service and very good burgers!I had the Steak Canadien and my wife had the pulled pork, excellent. We will be back

B384W96tU3Mfs6aB8lgAsQ.text: Its food. Its edible. The staff is nice. At the end of the day its a burger. I had a burger there awhile ago that I really liked and was saddened to see that it was gone last time I came here. So I instead had the ceasar salad with avocado... well thats what I ordered at least, they forgot the avo. Oh well, they saved me £2. My salad with chicken was super good. Really nice. The burger my partner had wasn't great for him but I thought it was pretty good. But personally, I prefer other burger joints than here. But its solid. The cocktail menu is diverse, and the decor is nice and the prices reflect that.

Ate5Esn1tFtDPvTR9PyFpA.text: This was the first restaurant that I ever ate at in London, and I am still coming here almost three years later. I absolutely love the burger, medium rare, on salad with egg. Since I require a gluten free diet, I find Haché accommodating without compromising taste. From the perspective of American connotations, it almost seems wrong to classify this as a "burger" place. It simply does not do justice to the quality of meat and unique taste that you get here.Please feel free to open a Haché in Cincinnati :)

tj3afpm8f0kDrR15oWqJNw.text: Delicious steak burgers, but the options are INTENSE. I actually didn't think very much of the Louisiana burger; while it was decently flavored I think the peanut butter took away rather than contributed to the overall taste. Still, it's a must order for those who are curious.I found the Mexican burger to be much more satisfying, and excellently presented with the guacamole, salsa and sour cream set individually in a tri-dish for self-ladling as needed. It was a spicy monster, and a great choice for the heat-inclined.

photos.caption: Photo of Hache - London, United Kingdom. Potato wedges w/ garlic mayo
Photo of Hache - London, United Kingdom. Steak Mexican

6pZku-s9a16zogLrWAr3QA.text: As a "London Burger" lover, I decided to try out Hache. The IceBurger caught my eye and must say it was spectacular!A perfect medium-rare (how I ordered it) party between iceberg lettuce, light salsa, and wonderful sauce.Simply amazing! I'd definitely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Hache - London, United Kingdom. Hache's IceBurger!

tQsjRSBpZOZw4nMncObKxA.text: I love fairy lights and this place has fairy lights shaped like branches of flowers! They are so pretty!Burger was good, well cooked and the option I got came with reblochon cheese which was quite unusual and the red onion chutney had some kind of peppercorn in it giving it a great crunch and flavour.Sides are good although oddly proportioned - wedges are huge and fries are much smaller. Wedges came with a bit of garlic mayo and some kind of tomato sauce - they should just leave the latter out, the mayo is much better. Sweet potato fries were good too - everywhere should do these. Onion rings seemed fine but, as the length of this paragraph devoted to sides implies, I kind of ordered too many sides, so I couldn't manage that many onion rings.Service was unobtrusive yet pleasant and efficient, especially considering we were quite a large group.Only thing that was a bit disappointing was the strawberry milkshake. My quest for a good quality milkshake continues...

efW06yFIcZCLoU1DSpryUA.text: 3.5First things first, the staff is impossibly beautiful at this location. Blondes or brunettes (don't recall any redheads), no matter your preference, you're bound to find some eye candy. This was a welcome sight, as I had just wandered the streets on a desolate Monday evening. I needed food before I became feverish. It was a good thing that I came in: I was nearly the only customer.Besides being empty and staffed with attractive women, I noticed that Hache was sterile in appearance. It was quite pretty but... cold. It wasn't that huge of a deal (considering I was pretty hungry) but it made it for an odd atmosphere as i waited for my grub. And, what to eat? Well, at an upscale burger & fries joint, I suppose one orders a burger and fries. I started the meal with a shake. I know London's more expensive than Miami but for almost 4 pounds, I expected more than the slightly runny strawberry concoction I received. Oh well. Time for the main event, eh? The chicken 'burger' was a flattened chicken breast served with an abundance of honey mustard sauce that was more mayo than mustard. It overpowered the cheese and bacon. Si. Es verdad. The sauce overpowered the bacon. *sad trombone* At least the fries lived up to the hype of reviews and pictures. As a warm respite on a cold late-winter's night, Hache is A-OK... but I have no need to rush back. My American expectations were a bit let down.

wni8SIXOomtsfh9jyLa7hw.text: Absolutely spectacular burgers, with a selection of perfectly executed classics as well as exciting and original flavour combinations.The restaurant is clean and warm and presentation of the food is fantastic. I loved that our fries came out in baby fryer baskets! A lot to be said for the sweet potato fries as well, they were just so so tasty.Hache burger, whilst a sizeable hit to your wallet for a burger & chips, is well worth the cash. burger lovers get down there immediately!

photos.caption: Photo of Hache - London, United Kingdom. Steak Bavarian. Absolutely delicious, definitely one for the cheese lovers!
Photo of Hache - London, United Kingdom. Cannot recommend the sweet potato fries enough!
Photo of Hache - London, United Kingdom. Love the fairy lights :-)

9V3ojJn4G9tDoxeQIt-v1w.text: This is a really fun place to eat with a creative menu.  There are lots of non-beef choices for those not inclined to have red meat, or any meat at all.  We did have to wait about 20 minutes for a table, but it was a Friday night and getting a table anywhere was a tricky task!  It's a really attractive restaurant, casual but intimate.  Dimly lit with these delicate white lights hung above mirrors makes the whole place shine.  They have a small wine list and inexpensive beer, like Hoegaarden and Budvar.  We started with some chicken wings - I think there were 6-8 in an order - and they were delicious and tasted like America.  Sweet potato fries were addicting, coleslaw was forgettable.  I had the chicken fajita burger which was incredibly messy from all the salsa, grilled onions, and gooey cheese.  It was really juicy for a chicken burger, which was definitely impressive!  Really fun place to stop if you're in the area, affordable and not too long of a wait makes it a great place for a weekend dinner.

UaQIwpnjLNRvHlTQOMBf0Q.text: I'll take a Haché burger over Byron or GBK any day!  I've eaten at Haché a handful of times and each experience has left me craving another burger.  The restaurant is a bit kitchy with fairy light hanging all over and M&M's arriving with your bill.  It's a great spot to bring picky eaters as the menu includes the traditional beef burger along with turkey, chicken and veggie options.  Loads of inspiring toppings and tasty sides are also found on the menu.  While you might be tempted to order a side a person, they are large portions and easily shared.  Solid spot!

WG3VNALlVF8f3Wxn7o7EkA.text: Heaven for an American in search of 'normal' food in London.This little gourmet burger joint is located in my favorite part of the city, Camden Town.  The restaurant itself was quite simple.  Built in a sort of shotgun layout, feminine decor, very simple . . . Our server was great.  I was going to gamble and try the Louisiana Burger (peanut butter and cheddar cheese) but was longing for a true burger (after a few days of 'London food').  I decided I'd put my fate in the hands of my server and asked what she felt about my choice and she sent me on a detour to the Bavarian burger.  I'm glad she did.  It was excellent. The basket of fries that accompanied it were also great.Nice atmosphere, good service, strong burgers.4 stars.
